info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 4:00PM EDT until June 17 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Greenville County in Upstate South Carolina... Northwestern Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 400 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles south of Hendersonville, or near Pleasant Ridge State Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Taylors, Slater-Marietta, Campobello, Paris Mountain State Park, Tigerville, Lake Robinson, Pleasant Ridge State Park, North Saluda Reservoir, Glassy Mountain and Cleveland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
